{/* Replace the main heading with the AboutUsTitle image */}

Who We Are

We are the English & Creative Writing Society, a pen of readers and writers who aim to fill pages and conjure stories from the wells of their imagination. We offer a sanctuary for the private wordsmiths to write away under the promise of warm reception when they are ready to share. For the jesters and poets who buzz off the ears and eyes that consume their work, we offer an audience eager to give feedback and noise. You will find a community here, for just because writing is an endeavour taken alone, it is not one that has to be lonely.

Our Values

Community: ECW strives to build a warm, welcoming community of writers of all skill levels and interests. Whether you enjoy writing high fantasy, free verse poetry, or even Pingu fanfiction where our beloved penguin gets expelled from igloo school, you'll find people eager to share in your enthusiasm.

Maintaning Good Habits: Writing is a sport! But university students are busy bees, and it can be tough to find time to write. Our society promotes consistent writing habits through weekly writing sessions, open to everyone. Whether your goal is to write a sentence or half a page, any progress is great progress, and ECW loves to support your writing goals.

Support: Our workshops provide a space to receive feedback, share your work, and engage with other writers. ECW helps writers see how their work is interpreted, answer creative questions, and explore different perspectives. We also support career development by connecting students with industry professionals to gain insight into the creative field.

Fun: Most of all, ECW prioritizes the fun of writing! Forget about convention and expectation—write for yourself and what you want to see. Writing can be serious, but it doesn’t have to be. Put words on the page and simply feel accomplished in the act of creation.

The ExecTeam 2025

Chalene Kuklin (President)

Yifei Pan (Secretary)

Albert Yan (Treasurer)

Jennifer Nguyen (Marketing)
